intro: Callista villosula, commonly known as the hairy callista, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
